<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 510, 89]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows a load suspended from a spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 298, 920, 332]]<|/det|>
The value of the spring constant \(k\) of the spring is \(0.20 \text{N} /\text{cm}\). The spring reaches its limit of proportionality when the load is \(15 \text{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 345, 146, 364]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 345, 650, 364]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 653, 920, 688]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A car travels at constant speed \(v\) on a horizontal, straight road. The driver sees an obstacle on the road ahead.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 119, 144, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 118, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
The distance travelled in the time between the driver seeing the obstruction and applying the brakes is the thinking distance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 658, 183]]<|/det|>
Explain why the thinking distance is directly proportional to \(v\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 257, 144, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 257, 920, 306]]<|/det|>
When the brakes are applied, the car decelerates uniformly to rest. The frictional force applied by the brakes is constant. The distance travelled between first applying the brakes and the car stopping is the braking distance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 319, 601, 337]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 451, 920, 485]]<|/det|>
The beam enters a region where there is a strong, uniform magnetic field. The direction of the magnetic field is out of the page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 497, 720, 516]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 621, 571, 640]]<|/det|>
Radioactive sources have many uses in medicine.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 653, 873, 670]]<|/det|>
State **two** safety precautions which hospital staff take when working with \(\gamma\) -ray sources.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 683, 175, 701]]<|/det|>
<label>1.</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 714, 170, 732]]<|/det|>
<label>2.</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 714, 920, 732]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
The radioactive isotope iodine-131 is used as a tracer in medical diagnosis. A nucleus of iodine-131 contains 53 protons and 78 neutrons. The symbol for iodine is I.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 181, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 613, 135]]<|/det|>
Use nuclide notation to show this isotope of iodine.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 230, 920, 249]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 247, 180, 266]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 247, 653, 266]]<|/det|>
Iodine-131 emits \(\gamma\) -radiation. It has a half-life of 8 hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 279, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
Explain why this emission and this half-life make iodine-131 a suitable material for a tracer in medical diagnosis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 418, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
